intro: Tetrapilus javanicus, commonly known as the Java tetrapilus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tetrapilus javanicus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
